body:
Ok, so soon i think i will be getting a new PC. its sad to see my mac os x go but lol, i am going to start a youtube and would prefer more than 40 fps when not recording. So, any good gaming laptops? I would prefer a bigger memory, and maybe a higher quality performance? Also I am taking some summer classes on Javascript, html, and more coding, because who wants to play chess for 2 hours (yes my mom actually asked if i want to do that). I am not sure what computer is best for coding(that is not a blackberry or raspberry), but im pretty sure i want a:
HD(very please)
reasonable cost($1-600)
good memory size(not good with math but like 5+ terrabytes?)
good for coding(meh not main goal)

note: i will also be editing and uploading on this pc so yeah.
Any good ones you know of?

thanks

-rattle2

title: Gaming PCs? (almost regarding cost)

replies.body:
you said pc in the op but laptop later

pc is a desktop computer
so a PC or a laptop?
replies.body_tagged:
you said pc in the op but laptop later

pc is a desktop computer
so a PC or a laptop?

replies.body:
I am a bit experiencied with coding java and coding really doesnt need a good PC.
If it fits into your budget, I would at least get one with 16 GB RAM, I use 4 GB and when I run e.g. a mod II code using Eclipse, it isnt enough.
